description:
I try to use the last nova trunk code (2012.1~e2~20111110.11434-0ubuntu0ppa1~natty2).

When I launch nova-api, it crashes just after loaded all compute extensions. And I cannot see anything in log file.
If I delete the contrib extension folder, I can start nova-api without problems.
title: nova-api crash

comments.content:
I try to use the last nova trunk code (2012.1~e2~20111110.11434-0ubuntu0ppa1~natty2).

When I launch nova-api, it crashes just after loaded all compute extensions. And I cannot see anything in log file.
If I delete the contrib extension folder, I can start nova-api without problems.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ethuleau

comments.content: Can you narrow this down to a specific extension?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content:
HI Brian,

It's not specific to an extension.
I checked, all distributed extensions are loaded. I tried to limit the extensions to only one => nova-api crashes instead.

If disable all extensions (remove the contrib compute extensions directory), nova-api starts correctly.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ethuleau

comments.content:
In foound a way to start the API.
If I let the flag 'allow_admin_api' to false (this the default value), the Nova API daemon starts correctly.
But If I put it to true, It crashes like I explained above.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ethuleau

comments.content:
Ok I found my problem.
I set a boolean flag to true (like this: --my_flag=True) and now we doesn't need to set it to true.
The flag is false by default so I just need to precise --my_flag to set it to true.

When I started nova-api with init script, I cannot see anything in the log api file.
I found this problem to start the API manually => I can see an explicit log about my flag definition error.

So my bug is invalid. I close it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ethuleau
